concise_definition: v. 保证, 担保, 确保 (guarantee 的现在分词形式)

definitions.explanation_en: To make a formal promise or assurance that something will happen, be true, or be done, often with a commitment to take responsibility if it fails.
definitions.explanation_cn: 作出正式承诺或保证某事一定会发生、属实或被完成，通常包含若未能实现则承担责任的承诺。
definitions.example_en: The manufacturer is guaranteeing a five-year warranty on all its products.
definitions.example_cn: 该制造商为其所有产品提供五年保修保证。

definitions.explanation_en: To ensure or secure a particular outcome or condition, often by taking preventive or protective measures.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过采取预防或保护措施，确保某种结果或状态得以实现。
definitions.example_en: By signing this contract, you are guaranteeing the timely delivery of the goods.
definitions.example_cn: 通过签署这份合同，你确保了货物的准时交付。

definitions.explanation_en: To provide a strong assurance that reduces uncertainty or risk for another party.
definitions.explanation_cn: 为另一方提供强有力的保证，以降低不确定性或风险。
definitions.example_en: The bank is guaranteeing the loan, so the borrower has a much better chance of approval.
definitions.example_cn: 银行为这笔贷款提供担保，因此借款人获得批准的可能性大为增加。

comparison.analysis: “Promise” (承诺) 是一种较主观、非正式的保证，通常不附带法律责任或补偿机制。而 “guaranteeing” 更正式、更具约束力，常涉及法律或经济责任，若未履行将产生后果。
“Assure” (使确信) 主要用于消除某人的疑虑，强调对人的心理影响，主语通常是人，宾语是人。例如：I assure you it’s safe。而 “guaranteeing” 强调对事物结果的承诺，主语可以是人或机构，宾语是事件或状态，具有更强的客观性和可执行性。
“Warrant” (担保/保证) 与 “guaranteeing” 非常接近，常用于法律或技术语境，但更侧重于“基于权威或证据的保证”，常用于书面文件中，如“warranty”。而 “guaranteeing” 更通用，涵盖商业、日常和情感层面的承诺。
